instructions: 1. Provide a clear, descriptive title for your recipe
2. Write a brief description explaining what the recipe accomplishes
3. Write the main content/instructions - this is the narrative that ties everything together
4. Add relevant keywords (comma-separated) for easy searching
5. Include code snippets with the following structure:

content_field_guide.purpose: The content field is the main narrative/instructions for your recipe. It explains the approach, key concepts, and how the pieces fit together.
content_field_guide.how_to_reference_snippets: Reference your code snippets by their 'ref' identifier. For example: 'See snippet setup_express for the initial configuration' or 'The middleware is configured in snippet cors_config'.
best_practices: Write content as if explaining the solution to a colleague
Reference snippets by their ref (e.g., 'see snippet email_trigger_example')
Explain WHY you chose this approach, not just WHAT it does
Mention any gotchas or common pitfalls

snippet_structure.ref: A unique reference identifier for this snippet (e.g., 'setup', 'main', 'helper')
snippet_structure.snippet: The actual code without markdown formatting - just plain code
snippet_structure.description: A brief description of what this snippet does

example.title: Setting up Express Server with CORS
example.description: A recipe for creating a basic Express.js server with CORS enabled
example.content: This recipe demonstrates a standard Express.js server setup with CORS enabled. Start by importing dependencies (see snippet setup), then configure middleware (see snippet middleware), and finally start the server (see snippet server). This pattern works well for APIs that need to accept requests from browser-based applications.

snippets.description: Import dependencies and create Express app

security_warning.title: ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Do Not Include Secrets
security_warning.message: If your recipes.db is committed to version control (recommended for team sharing), ALL recipe content will be visible to anyone with repository access.
avoid: Any sensitive customer or proprietary data
instead_use: Secret management patterns without actual values

tips: ⚠️ NEVER include API keys, passwords, or secrets - use placeholders or env vars
Keep snippet refs short and memorable
Use descriptive keywords for better searchability
Break complex code into multiple snippets with clear refs
Don't include markdown code fences (```) in snippet content
Include proper context in snippet descriptions

how_to_call_create_recipe.important: After reading this guide, you must set has_read_howto: true when calling create_recipe

required_parameters.has_read_howto: true (REQUIRED - confirms you've read this guide)
required_parameters.title: string - Recipe title
required_parameters.content: string - Main narrative referencing snippets by their ref
required_parameters.snippets: array - Code snippets with ref, snippet, language, description (optional)
